content.description: Start either low on roof crack (unclimbed but reasonable-looking) or traverse in from right. Climb the corner past gear to a face with seams and patina holds protected by 2 bolts and gear.
content.protection: gear and 2 bolts
content.location: just left of the 5.8 corner

content.description:
This is a left leaning crack just left of Electric Lichen. Unknown FA or grade but it looks moderate. Look for a small tree about 2/3 of the way up.

 Old slings but no modern anchor at top
content.protection: Gear
content.location: Left ofelectric lichen

content.description: Crux up high, techy.
content.protection: 7 botls + Anchors
content.location: Middle of three routes on the beautiful orange feature midway through the prospectors trail.

content.description:
A mostly bolted line that climbs the wild black and orange face to a hard move on the arete up high. Could be done by stick clipping bolt 1 or placing gear to protect the start. 

 Start just right of a gully and left of the ground-level overhangs. Climb past a horizontal gear placement on your right to a line of 5 bolts.

 Morning shade, afternoon sun
content.protection: 5 bolts and finger size cam at start

content.description:
Ever try Salewa Table Bouldering? Here is your chance to put your practice to use! The rest of the route is superb as well.

 Start below a shelf of rock just above head height with a bolt higher up. Stick-clipping the bolt is recommended before starting the table bouldering. Wrestle with the shelf to get stood up. Difficult to grade. Continue up the amazing bullet hard sandstone with amazing horizontals, slopy ledges, great crimps, and one more bolt.
content.protection: A single rack of cams from fingers to #2. A couple of quick draws for the bolts. Two bolt anchor at the top. 60m rope is plenty to rappel.
content.location: This is the first section of rock just past the Breaking Into Trad wall.

content.description: The rightmost and harder line of the duo. Step into the blocky crack system and get gear (finger size). Continue up the steep orange corner past 3 bolts to the anchor.
content.protection: 3 bolts and finger size cam
content.location: Located several hundred yards left of "Breaking Traditions". If walking the Prospectors trail, it is uphill almost directly above the large boulder in the trail.

content.description: This is the leftmost line on the small separate orange wall holding 2 routes. A fun moderate warm up for this area of the crag. Climb the line of 3 bolts to ledge. Clip the last bolt and continue up right to an anchor at the very top.
content.protection: 4 bolts
content.location: Located several hundred yards left of "Breaking Traditions". If walking the Prospectors trail, it is uphill almost directly above the large boulder in the trail.

content.description:
Start just right of Sunkist at a distinct bucket hold around chest level and under a bolt 12 feet up. Make weird sidepull moves up past bolt to small roof and a bolt above to the right. Move right and up to a face and flake system protected by gear and one more bolt.

 Morning shade, afternoon sun
content.protection: 3 bolts, gear to hand size cams
content.location: See description

content.description:
Climbs the righthand line of the twin routes on the amazing orange colored lichen face, just left of Sunkist, and right of an old unknown crack climb. Climb the orange face past gear to a 2 closely-spaced bolts at a technical crux. Continue up thin corner features protected by gear to an anchor on the right side of the ledge below a capstone wall.

 Morning sun, late afternoon shade
content.protection: 2 bolts, gear to hand size
content.location: On wall left of Sunkist.

content.description:
Climbs the lefthand line of twin routes on the amazing orange colored lichen face, just left of Sunkist, and right of an old unknown crack climb.

 Climb the flake past gear to a line of 4 bolts and a technical crux to an anchor on the left side of ledge below a capstone wall.
content.protection: 4 bolts and gear to hand size cam
content.location: Lefthand line of two routes on the face with orange lichen, just left of Sunkist.

content.description: Thin at the top, not at the bottom.  Have Fun
content.protection: Bolts+Anchors
content.location: A little chunk of Orange cliff found about dead center in the middle of Prospectors Trail.  Furthest Left Route on the wall.

content.description:
Climb the easy corner to the roofs and follow jugs out the dihedral in the roof to a great stance. Continue up the wild orange lichen arete and face past bolts and gear to the anchor on ledge at the top.

 The bottom stays shady most of the day. The upper gets morning sun but is generally breezy.
content.protection: 6 bolts and gear to hand size cam
content.location: Just left of lower-angle face and chimney systems, and right of huge roofs. Also, a hundred or so yards right of "Bad Turtle" (which for some reason is out of order on this page).

content.description: Fun stout arete climbing. Begin the same as Breaking A Sweat. Instead of moving right, stay on the arete past two bolts on a steep rock. Heel hooks, slapping, and some gumption will get you to a positive stance above. Follow two more bolts up another steep face to the shared anchor. Some gear can be inter-spaced if you really want to sew it up.
content.protection: Several bolts lead to a two bolt anchor. Small to medium sized gear can be inter-spaced. Two bolt anchor at the top.
content.location: Start on the rounded grey arete just left of the flake features. A large flat rock makes it easier to reach the starting holds.

content.description: Look for the obvious right-facing flake just to the left of Breaking Bad. Follow the flake up, then turn left for the second crack system. Follow this to the anchors just below the lip. This route still needs some cleaning, but fun regardless.
content.protection: Bring a single rack, no bolts. Two bolt anchor at the top.
content.location: Big right-facing flake. Anchors are obvious from below.

content.description:
Amazing horizontals split by beautiful bulbous gray stone.

 Climb up the pebble conglomerate to a horizontal with gear. Make some techy moves up to the large broken ledge and first bolt. Find the holds just below the shallow left-facing flake. Get a good finger size piece here and pull the fun flake move.The rest is just amazing steep horizontals with bomber gear.
content.protection: Bring a single rack and some extras in the finger to .75 sizes. Two bolt anchor at the top.
content.location: Just left around corner from Breaking Glass. Obvious clean grey face laced with horiztonals. Look for the single bolt down low in the orange rock.

content.description: A gorgeous set of twin gold cracks leads to a bulgy top out. Great gear and moves the whole way.
content.protection: Bring a single rack with nuts, tricams can be handy. One bolt at the bulge. Two bolt anchor at the top to rappel.
content.location: Closest route to the trail, the twin cracks are obvious from below.

content.description:
Unbelievably good. Holds just where you need something!

 Start at the left arete next to Breaking Bud. Find the miraculous iron crimps out left and pull up the arete. When you hit the first horizontal break begin moving right into the large left-facing flake. Follow the flake to another horiztonal section and then another short left-facing flake. Get some gear at the base of the flake. Find another perfect hold just above the short flake. Steep pulls lead to a slopey topout over the bulge.
content.protection: All gear. Standard rack extra in the thin to finger size. Move left at the top to the shared anchor with Breaking Traditions
content.location: Look for the two left-facing flakes, one large down low and a small one up high. Begin on the arete just left.

content.description: Start in an easy alcove 20 feet right of Breaking Bad.  Work into crack feature to a good gear horizontal At crux.  Head up to a ledge with a solid TCU to protect moves to anchors.
content.protection: Gear
content.location: 20 feet right of Breaking Bud and a few hundred yards left of 5.9 Splitter

content.description: The leftmost line on this obvious buttress capped by large boulder atop the square arete. Climb the crack to the roof and step right continuing through roof on jugs and jams to a rest on ledge below the arete. Climb past 2 bolts on the technical arete, with the crux being the last move to the anchors under the capstone boulder. Spoiler alert: Look for a trick hold around the arete for the crux.
content.protection: rack to gold camalot. Perhaps doubles in finger size, and/or red camalot
content.location: about 100 feet right of "5.9 spliter"

content.description: Sweet, rounded arete.  Begin in crack with a tree at your back, then hug the arete up to anchors.
content.protection: Gear 1 bolt, anchors
content.location: Arete on Right side of buttress.  10 feet right of Breakin Through.

content.description: Crank the chossy start to gain a corner which is then followed past good gear to a line of bolts up the gently overhanging face. The crux is at the very end!
content.protection: light rack of nuts/green camalot for start. all bolts above
content.location: center of the buttress

content.description: Worth the extra walk from the concentration of routes on the north end of Prospectors Trail. Climbs the prominent orange streak.
content.protection: 4-5 bolts
content.location: It is quicker to access this route by taking the Tower Tunnel Trail to the Prospectors Trail unless you are coming from the concentration of routes on the north side of Prospectors. It is located past the switchback leading down to the river trail if you are coming from the concentration of routes on north side of Prospectors.

content.description: Climb the obvious hand size crack that gradually thins to fingers at the top. Anchors are a move above the ledge and below the huge conifer on top.
content.protection: gear
content.location: A few hundred yards right of "Breaking Bad" and across the drainage. Leftmost line on this buttress. This one and all routes right might be better listed under the new area to the right (homestead).

content.description: A very fun hand and fist size corner crack that is a good warm up for this buttress. Climb it to the top.
content.protection: gear to # 4 camalot
content.location: Start below obvious crack at a highpoint along the base

content.description: Some of the best stone around. Nuttall style horizontals and cracks galore. The cliff faces mostly west and is a fairly easy approach. The wall gets afternoon sun in the warmer months. As with most areas, there is still quite a bit of trash in the area. If you see it, pile it up if you can't carry it out.
